author: Mehboob Jeelani
text:
: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, who is negotiating a pre-poll alliance with the DMK for the upcoming Tamil Nadu elections, met the party president Sonia Gandhi on Saturday to brief her on his meeting with DMK president M Karunanidhi in Chennai on Friday.

Though Mr. Karunanidhi reportedly offered the Congress only about 30 seats, Mr. Azad, according to sources, is optimistic about getting a “reasonable share” in the next round of talks.

A senior Congress leader said Ms. Gandhi told Mr.Azad that she would like to discuss the matter with party vice-president Rahul Gandhi and other senior leaders before taking a call. The meeting is likely to happen early next week, in which Tamil Nadu PCC chief E.V.K.S. Elangovan will also participate.

A senior Congress leader said that if the DMK wouldn’t offer around 40 seats, the party would prefer to fight alone. “We are facing a lot of pressure from our workers,” the leader said. “They are demanding at least 60 seats but we will be happy with anything between 40 and 45 seats.”

Speaking to The Hindu , S.V. Ramani, a senior Congress leader from Chennai who currently oversees the party’s media cell in Delhi, said the DMK should not decide on Congress party’s seat share by weighing its performance (4 seats out of 63) in the previous assembly elections. In the 2011 elections, the DMK won only 23 of the 127 seats it contested. “Their [DMK’s] performance was equally bad. So they should not use go by the logic of drawing comparisons with previous elections,” Mr. Ramani added.
title: Sonia to consult Rahul, others on DMK’s offer
